intro: Psychotria frondosa, commonly known as the "Crimson Beauty," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria frondosa is also noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
